00016 #include "btAlignedAllocator.h"

00018 int gNumAlignedAllocs = 0;
00019 int gNumAlignedFree = 0;
00020 int gTotalBytesAlignedAllocs = 0;//detect memory leaks

00022 static void *btAllocDefault(size_t size)
00023 {
00024         return malloc(size);
00025 }
00026 
00027 static void btFreeDefault(void *ptr)
00028 {
00029         free(ptr);
00030 }
00031 
00032 static btAllocFunc *sAllocFunc = btAllocDefault;
00033 static btFreeFunc *sFreeFunc = btFreeDefault;
00034

00037 #if defined (BT_HAS_ALIGNED_ALLOCATOR)
00038 #include <malloc.h>
00039 static void *btAlignedAllocDefault(size_t size, int alignment)
00040 {
00041         return _aligned_malloc(size, (size_t)alignment);
00042 }
00043 
00044 static void btAlignedFreeDefault(void *ptr)
00045 {
00046         _aligned_free(ptr);
00047 }
00048 #elif defined(__CELLOS_LV2__)
00049 #include <stdlib.h>
00050 
00051 static inline void *btAlignedAllocDefault(size_t size, int alignment)
00052 {
00053         return memalign(alignment, size);
00054 }
00055 
00056 static inline void btAlignedFreeDefault(void *ptr)
00057 {
00058         free(ptr);
00059 }
00060 #else
00061 
00062 
00063 
00064 
00065 
00066 static inline void *btAlignedAllocDefault(size_t size, int alignment)
00067 {
00068   void *ret;
00069   char *real;
00070   real = (char *)sAllocFunc(size + sizeof(void *) + (alignment-1));
00071   if (real) {
00072         ret = btAlignPointer(real + sizeof(void *),alignment);
00073     *((void **)(ret)-1) = (void *)(real);
00074   } else {
00075     ret = (void *)(real);
00076   }
00077   return (ret);
00078 }
00079 
00080 static inline void btAlignedFreeDefault(void *ptr)
00081 {
00082   void* real;
00083 
00084   if (ptr) {
00085     real = *((void **)(ptr)-1);
00086     sFreeFunc(real);
00087   }
00088 }
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 
00092 static btAlignedAllocFunc *sAlignedAllocFunc = btAlignedAllocDefault;
00093 static btAlignedFreeFunc *sAlignedFreeFunc = btAlignedFreeDefault;
00094 
00095 void btAlignedAllocSetCustomAligned(btAlignedAllocFunc *allocFunc, btAlignedFreeFunc *freeFunc)
00096 {
00097   sAlignedAllocFunc = allocFunc ? allocFunc : btAlignedAllocDefault;
00098   sAlignedFreeFunc = freeFunc ? freeFunc : btAlignedFreeDefault;
00099 }
00100 
00101 void btAlignedAllocSetCustom(btAllocFunc *allocFunc, btFreeFunc *freeFunc)
00102 {
00103   sAllocFunc = allocFunc ? allocFunc : btAllocDefault;
00104   sFreeFunc = freeFunc ? freeFunc : btFreeDefault;
00105 }

00107 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOCATIONS
00108 
00109 static int allocations_id[10241024];
00110 static int allocations_bytes[10241024];
00111 static int mynumallocs = 0;
00112 #include <stdio.h>
00113 
00114 int btDumpMemoryLeaks()
00115 {
00116         int totalLeak = 0;
00117         
00118         for (int i=0;i<mynumallocs;i++)
00119         {
00120                 printf("Error: leaked memory of allocation #%d (%d bytes)\n", allocations_id[i], allocations_bytes[i]);
00121                 totalLeak+=allocations_bytes[i];
00122         }
00123         if (totalLeak)
00124         {
00125                 printf("Error: memory leaks: %d allocations were not freed and leaked together %d bytes\n",mynumallocs,totalLeak);
00126         }
00127         return totalLeak;
00128 }
00129 //this generic allocator provides the total allocated number of bytes
00130 #include <stdio.h>
00131 
00132 struct btDebugPtrMagic
00133 {
00134         union
00135         {
00136                 void** vptrptr;
00137                 void* vptr;
00138                 int* iptr;
00139                 char* cptr;
00140         };
00141 };

00143 
00144 void*   btAlignedAllocInternal  (size_t size, int alignment,int line,char* filename)
00145 {
00146         if (size==0)
00147         {
00148                 printf("Whaat? size==0");
00149                 return 0;
00150         }
00151         static int allocId = 0;
00152         
00153  void *ret;
00154  char *real;
00155 
00156 // to find some particular memory leak, you could do something like this:
00157 //      if (allocId==172)
00158 //      {
00159 //              printf("catch me!\n");
00160 //      }
00161 //      if (size>1024*1024)
00162 //      {
00163 //              printf("big alloc!%d\n", size);
00164 //      }
00165 
00166  gTotalBytesAlignedAllocs += size;
00167  gNumAlignedAllocs++;
00168 
00169  
00170 int sz4prt = 4*sizeof(void *);
00171         
00172  real = (char *)sAllocFunc(size + sz4prt + (alignment-1));
00173  if (real) {
00174          
00175    ret = (void*) btAlignPointer(real + sz4prt, alignment);
00176          btDebugPtrMagic p;
00177          p.vptr = ret;
00178          p.cptr-=sizeof(void*);
00179          *p.vptrptr = (void*)real;
00180          p.cptr-=sizeof(void*);
00181          *p.iptr = size;
00182          p.cptr-=sizeof(void*);
00183          *p.iptr = allocId;
00184          
00185          allocations_id[mynumallocs] = allocId;
00186          allocations_bytes[mynumallocs] = size;
00187          mynumallocs++;
00188 
00189  } else {
00190    ret = (void *)(real);//??
00191  }
00192 
00193  printf("allocation %d at address %x, from %s,line %d, size %d (total allocated = %d)\n",allocId,real, filename,line,size,gTotalBytesAlignedAllocs);
00194         allocId++;
00195         
00196  int* ptr = (int*)ret;
00197  *ptr = 12;
00198  return (ret);
00199 }
00200 
00201 void    btAlignedFreeInternal   (void* ptr,int line,char* filename)
00202 {
00203 
00204  void* real;
00205 
00206  if (ptr) {
00207          gNumAlignedFree++;
00208 
00209          btDebugPtrMagic p;
00210          p.vptr = ptr;
00211          p.cptr-=sizeof(void*);
00212          real = *p.vptrptr;
00213          p.cptr-=sizeof(void*);
00214          int size = *p.iptr;
00215          p.cptr-=sizeof(void*);
00216          int allocId = *p.iptr;
00217 
00218          bool found = false;
00219          
00220          for (int i=0;i<mynumallocs;i++)
00221          {
00222                  if ( allocations_id[i] == allocId)
00223                  {
00224                          allocations_id[i] = allocations_id[mynumallocs-1];
00225                          allocations_bytes[i] = allocations_bytes[mynumallocs-1];
00226                          mynumallocs--;
00227                          found = true;
00228                          break;
00229                  }
00230          }
00231          
00232         
00233         gTotalBytesAlignedAllocs -= size;
00234 
00235          int diff = gNumAlignedAllocs-gNumAlignedFree;
00236         printf("free %d at address %x, from %s,line %d, size %d (total remain = %d in %d non-freed allocations)\n",allocId,real, filename,line,size, gTotalBytesAlignedAllocs, diff);
00237 
00238    sFreeFunc(real);
00239  } else
00240  {
00241          //printf("deleting a NULL ptr, no effect\n");
00242  }
00243 }
00244 
00245 #else //BT_DEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOCATIONS
00246 
00247 void*   btAlignedAllocInternal  (size_t size, int alignment)
00248 {
00249         gNumAlignedAllocs++;
00250         void* ptr;
00251         ptr = sAlignedAllocFunc(size, alignment);
00252 //      printf("btAlignedAllocInternal %d, %x\n",size,ptr);
00253         return ptr;
00254 }
00255 
00256 void    btAlignedFreeInternal   (void* ptr)
00257 {
00258         if (!ptr)
00259         {
00260                 return;
00261         }
00262 
00263         gNumAlignedFree++;
00264 //      printf("btAlignedFreeInternal %x\n",ptr);
00265         sAlignedFreeFunc(ptr);
00266 }
00267 
00268 #endif //BT_DEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOCATIONS
